title-group.article-title: Michel de Certeau: walking the via negativa

ref.mixed-citation: Walter Benjamin, 'One-Way Street,' in Reflections , edited by Peter Demetz, translated by Edmund Jephcott (New York, Schocken, 1986), 85.
Michel de Certeau, The Practice of Everyday Life, translated (in some fashion) by Steven Rendali (Berkeley, Los Angeles, London, University of California Press, 1984), 91.

Chapter Seven, 'Walking in the City,' is on 91-110. A version of this essay also appears as 'Practices of Space' (translated by R. Miller and E. Schneider) in Marshall Blonsky, ed., On Signs (Baltimore, The Johns Hopkins University Press, 1985), 122-45.
